nodes.text: Garro was a Force-sensitive human male who taught Jedi Master Yoda, while they were inside a mountain which they discovered to be alive, in the ways of the stonepower, an aspect of the Force that was only attainable by being in proximity to blue stone, a type of stone imbued with the Living Force.
After training Yoda, Garro and the Master went out from the mountain, but Garro betrayed Yoda and joined the Rockhawkers.
Garro was exiled from his people because he was considered a coward since he couldn't kill in battle. He was sent inside the mountain that stood near the village where he lived.

Somewhen between 44 and 32 BBY, Garro was found, almost starving, in a cave inside a mountain by the Jedi Grand Master Yoda. The Master helped him find some food, and the boy, to repay him, taught him the ways of the stonepower. While they were there, they discovered that the mountain was alive and tried to establish a connection using the Force.

Garro helped Yoda wake the mountain up, and once it was awake, they decided to go out from the cave. The Jedi and the boy climbed down but were intercepted by the Rockhawkers. The sons asked them if they had found the heart of the mountain. While Yoda didn't want to tell them, Garro betrayed his student and explained everything to the Rockhawkers, and he eventually joined them.
Yoda went back to Mucktown to prepare the Mud dwellers for war, while Garro, with the help of the Rockhawkers, took the control of the living mountain.
Garro first appeared in the comic Star Wars (2015) 28, written by Jason Aaron and illustrated by Salvador Larroca and Edgar Delgado.
